column1: #Text=The polycrystalline samples of Co2.77Mn1.71Fe1.10Zn0.42O8 were synthesized through the solid-state reaction method.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of Co2O3, Fe2O3, ZnO, and different valence of Mn, i. e. Mn3O4, Mn2O3, and MnO2 were taken as the starting reagents (99.9% purity, 5 μm, Anhui Kerun Nano Technology Co., Ltd., China).
#Text=The weighed powders, deionized water, and alcohol (the mass ratio is 1:0.6:0.6) were ball-milled for 10 h in a Teflon jar using agate balls.
#Text=The obtained slurries were dried at 95 °C in an oven (Keelrein DHG-9140, China) for 24 h.
#Text=The dried powders were ground and then calcinated at 850 °C for 2 h.
#Text=The calcinated powders were ball-milled again for 12 h and dried.
#Text=The as-obtained powder was shaped into pellets (10 mm × 2 mm) and then pressed by cold isostatic pressing (CIP150/500–600, China) at a pressure of 150 MPa for 130 s.
#Text=Subsequently, the green body was sintered at 1180 °C for 3 h (ZZ-1-6-14, Chengdu Langchen Electronic Co., Ltd., China).
